commit_message:
Allocations leaked during migration rollback

Allocations committed against the destination host are not reverted
during live migration rollbacks. The reason is that we're not passing
the migrate data object properly.

At some point, the rollback callback signature has changed. We picked
it up but only for the main (non-cluster) driver:
I5f247d733642464f4ede0430d4dfc8a27a02e7fd

This change addresses the cluster driver as well.

Change-Id: I8c509d411b8fdf7e65622f1fbb2095fe9c3b98b5
Closes-Bug: #1841068
(cherry picked from commit d9c1cb6aa1c6979c8a80a7d9b95f49e61e964b3a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/94/679994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Image deletion returns 500 if 'file' store is not enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-25 15:04:48.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/images.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/96cf9a2dff68d1c154723a2f70ae9a4ad7ba91e9', 'message': "Image deletion returns 500 if 'file' store is not enabled

When image import fails during image is uploading from staging area,
image remains in uploading state and data remains in staging area. In
this scenario if 'file' store is not enabled then while deleting the
image glance-api returns 500 status code with error 'file' scheme is
Unknwon.

Used os module to unlink the file present in staging area explicitly to
delete the data from staging area.

Change-Id: I57dcd6b18b0039e824e8adbe77de59079360a34f
Closes-Bug: #1836140
(cherry picked from commit 7f74a92338894d01feebf706663b1b5a10d99ece)
"}]
commit_message:
Image deletion returns 500 if 'file' store is not enabled

When image import fails during image is uploading from staging area,
image remains in uploading state and data remains in staging area. In
this scenario if 'file' store is not enabled then while deleting the
image glance-api returns 500 status code with error 'file' scheme is
Unknwon.

Used os module to unlink the file present in staging area explicitly to
delete the data from staging area.

Change-Id: I57dcd6b18b0039e824e8adbe77de59079360a34f
Closes-Bug: #1836140
(cherry picked from commit 7f74a92338894d01feebf706663b1b5a10d99ece)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/53/672753/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os """Ensure uploading image is deleted (LP bug #1733289) Ensure image stuck in uploading state is deleted (LP bug #1836140) """ with mock.patch.object(os.path, 'exists') as mock_exists: mock_exists.return_value = True with mock.patch.object(os, "unlink") as mock_unlik: self.controller.delete(request, image_id) self.assertEqual(1, mock_exists.call_count) self.assertEqual(1, mock_unlik.call_count) # Ensure that image is deleted image = self.db.image_get(request.context, image_id, force_show_deleted=True) self.assertTrue(image['deleted']) self.assertEqual('deleted', image['status']) def test_deletion_of_staging_data_failed(self): """Ensure uploading image is deleted (LP bug #1733289) Ensure image stuck in uploading state is deleted (LP bug #1836140) """ request = unit_test_utils.get_fake_request(is_admin=True) image = self.db.image_create(request.context, {'status': 'uploading'}) image_id = image['id'] with mock.patch.object(os.path, 'exists') as mock_exists: mock_exists.return_value = False with mock.patch.object(os, "unlink") as mock_unlik: self.controller.delete(request, image_id) self.assertEqual(1, mock_exists.call_count) self.assertEqual(0, mock_unlik.call_count) # Ensure that image is deleted
deleted_lines: """Ensure status of uploading image is updated (LP bug #1733289)""" with mock.patch.object(self.store, 'delete_from_backend') as mock_store: self.controller.delete(request, image_id) # Ensure delete_from_backend is called self.assertEqual(1, mock_store.call_count)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-07 09:54:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/bad28d6e09d3a08e4041a215be75b00b8ed779af', 'message': 'Add conditional field matching

commit_message:
Add conditional field matching

Adds the ability to conditionally match sushy fields against
received JSON object.

The conditional matching is performed by a user-supplied callable
which gets the key to consider (along with the value and potentially
other details) and should indicate the the caller if the match
occurred.

The motivation behind this change is to accommodate malformed Redfish
resource properties as observed in the OEM wilderness.

Change-Id: I9da9a83b72b670e15b53ef906f186473340c0935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/73/675073/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds the ability to conditionally match sushy fields against received JSON object. The conditional matching is performed by a user-supplied callable which gets the key to consider (along with the value and potentially other details) and should indicate the the caller if the match occurred. The motivation behind this change is to accommodate malformed Redfish resource properties as observed in the OEM wilderness.

commit_message:
Allocations leaked during migration rollback

Allocations committed against the destination host are not reverted
during live migration rollbacks. The reason is that we're not passing
the migrate data object properly.

At some point, the rollback callback signature has changed. We picked
it up but only for the main (non-cluster) driver:
I5f247d733642464f4ede0430d4dfc8a27a02e7fd

This change addresses the cluster driver as well.

Change-Id: I8c509d411b8fdf7e65622f1fbb2095fe9c3b98b5
Closes-Bug: #1841068

commit_message:
re-calculate provider mapping during migration

Nova intentionally does not persist the resoruce request of the neturon
ports. Therefore during migration nova needs to query neturon about the
resource requests to include them to the allocation_candidates query
sent to placement during scheduling. Also when the allocation is made by
the scheduler nova needs to re-calculate request group - resource
provider mapping. A subsequent patch will use this mapping to update the
binding profile when the port is bound to the destination host of the
migration.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: I8e5a0480c81ba548bc1f50a8098eabac52b11453

subject: HA: fix <service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-28 16:56:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/13e364fc1769d3427b8e3a061753b2d9375c171a', 'message': "HA: fix <service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow

For each HA service we have a paunch container <service>_restart_bundle
which is started by paunch whenever config files changes during stack
deploy/update. This container runs a pcs command on a single node to
restart all the service's containers (e.g. all galera on all controllers).
By design, when it is run, configs have already been regenerated by the
deploy tasks on all nodes.

For minor updates, the workflow runs differently: all the steps of the
deploy tasks are run one node after the other, so when
<service>_restart_bundle is called, there is no guarantee that the
service's configs have been regenerated on all the nodes yet.

To fix the wrong restart behaviour, only restart local containers when
running during a minor update. And run once per node. When the minor
update workflow calls <service>_restart_container, we still have the
guarantee that the config files are already regenerated locally.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45

commit_message:
HA: fix <service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow

For each HA service we have a paunch container <service>_restart_bundle
which is started by paunch whenever config files changes during stack
deploy/update. This container runs a pcs command on a single node to
restart all the service's containers (e.g. all galera on all controllers).
By design, when it is run, configs have already been regenerated by the
deploy tasks on all nodes.

For minor updates, the workflow runs differently: all the steps of the
deploy tasks are run one node after the other, so when
<service>_restart_bundle is called, there is no guarantee that the
service's configs have been regenerated on all the nodes yet.

To fix the wrong restart behaviour, only restart local containers when
running during a minor update. And run once per node. When the minor
update workflow calls <service>_restart_container, we still have the
guarantee that the config files are already regenerated locally.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45
Closes-Bug: #1841629

commit_message:
telemetry-tempest-plugin: Switch to python3 only

There is only a python3 tempest version so it doesn't make sense to
have py2 and py3 for the telemetry plugin.
Also fix the Requires.

Change-Id: I57e4d21ab9a14d1733720e940f2ea8d49bd5c1dd

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2019-04-06 01:36:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-placement/commit/35d3301b78084d57a61ed808f6b10d14e17cb422', 'message': "Add 'resource provider inventory update' command

This adds a new 'update' command which can update resource provider
inventory without requiring the user to pass a full replacement for
inventory like the 'set' command requires. It does a GET for existing
inventory, applies user provided updates, and does a PUT of the updated
inventory.

The command also has the ability to batch inventory updates for all
resource providers that are members of a specified --aggregate. And it
has a --dry-run option to preview changes before effecting them.

The main motivation for this command is to give operators a tool to
make setting overcommit allocation ratios on a per-aggregate basis
easier, after the functionality from the old
Aggregate[Core|Ram|Disk]Filter scheduler filters was removed back in
Ocata [1].

Because the command is quite generic, operators can also use it to do
any inventory update without having to do the GET, update, PUT,
manually and batch any update for all resource provider members of an
aggregate.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126283.html

Change-Id: Ib0cbb58d0adbbcfe83ee48d2ff6c9af1a516a7ae
"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2019-07-30 18:37:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-placement/commit/b182a6b8e886a35b1fd641156a3a76014eaa398e', 'message': "Add --amend option to 'resource provider inventory set'

commit_message:
Add --aggregate option to 'resource provider inventory set'

This adds a new '--aggregate' option which can set resource provider
inventory for all resource providers that are members of the specified
aggregate.

The main motivation for this option is to give operators a tool to
make setting overcommit allocation ratios on a per-aggregate basis
easier, after the functionality from the old
Aggregate[Core|Ram|Disk]Filter scheduler filters was removed back in
Ocata [1].

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126283.html

Story: 2006318
Task: 36189

Change-Id: Ib0cbb58d0adbbcfe83ee48d2ff6c9af1a516a7ae

commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: Ife8461f00ba2206d18ae45837bbc31d211e29841

It's a community goal[0] to have PDF docs available.

Also some minor fixes are needed for PDF:
- Only show genindex and search for HTML. Theses elements do not make

- Do not include full config sample files. This will not work and
produces a "Dimension too large" error during the latex run.

[0]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Change-Id: I66b8c47d599c97e66c2ca76faa66204d5e7c9c3b
'}]
commit_message:
Add PDF documentation build

This commit adds a new tox target to build PDF documentation.
It's a community goal[0] to have PDF docs available.

Also some minor fixes are needed for PDF:
- Only show genindex and search for HTML. Theses elements do not make
sense within PDF documents
- Do not include full config sample files. This will not work and
produces a "Dimension too large" error during the latex run.

[0]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Change-Id: I66b8c47d599c97e66c2ca76faa66204d5e7c9c3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/01/678801/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:pdf-docs] basepython = python3 deps = {[testenv:docs]deps} whitelist_externals = make commands = sphinx-build -W -b latex doc/source doc/build/pdf make -C doc/build/pdf

commit_message:
Update driver interface

spawn() now accepts the "power_on" flag, allowing instances to be
created without being turned on. This is part of the cross-cell
migration workflow.

Change-Id: Ifd18a69f476ebbfb4ee6ec34abb03da0d2e30ceb

" "<https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/SHIB2/" "NativeSPAddAttribute>`__." msgid ""msgid "" "Federated Identity provides a way to securely use existing credentials to " "access cloud resources such as servers, volumes, and databases, across " "multiple endpoints provided in multiple authorized clouds using a single set " "of credentials, without having to provision additional identities or log in " "multiple times. The credential is maintained by the user's Identity Provider." msgstr "" "Fderierte Identitt bietet einen Weg, um vorhandene Anmeldeinformationen " "sicher zu nutzen, um auf Cloud-Ressourcen wie Server, Volumes und " "Datenbanken zuzugreifen, und zwar ber mehrere Endpunkte hinweg, die in " "mehreren autorisierten Clouds mit einem einzigen Satz von " "Anmeldeinformationen bereitgestellt werden, ohne dass zustzliche " "Identitten bereitgestellt oder mehrmals angemeldet werden mssen. Die " "Berechtigung wird vom Identity Provider des Benutzers gepflegt." msgid "" "Federated users are not mirrored in the Identity service back end (for " "example, using the SQL driver). The external IdP is responsible for " "authenticating users, and communicates the result of the authentication to " "Identity service using SAML assertions. Identity service maps the SAML " "assertions to keystone user groups and assignments created in Identity " "service." msgstr "" "Fderierte Benutzer werden nicht im Identity-Service-Backend gespiegelt (z. " "B. mit dem SQL-Treiber). Die externe IDP ist fr die Authentifizierung von " "Benutzern zustndig und bertrgt das Ergebnis der Authentifizierung an den " "Identity Service mit SAML-Assertionen. Identity Service ordnet die SAML-" "Assertionen zu Keystone-Benutzergruppen und Zuweisungen im Identity Service " "zu." msgid "" "Fernet tokens are the supported token provider for Pike (default). Fernet is " "a secure messaging format explicitly designed for use in API tokens. They " "are non-persistent (no need to be persisted to a database), lightweight " "(fall in range of 180 to 240 bytes) and reduce the operational overhead " "required to run a cloud. Authentication and authorization metadata is neatly " "bundled into a message packed payload, which is then encrypted and signed in " "as a fernet token." msgstr "" "Fernet-Token sind der untersttzte Token-Provider fr Pike (Standard). " "Fernet ist ein sicheres Messaging-Format, das explizit fr den Einsatz in " "API-Token entwickelt wurde. Sie sind nicht persistent (keine Notwendigkeit, " "in einer Datenbank persistiert zu werden), leicht (im Bereich von 180 bis " "240 Bytes) und reduzieren den Betriebsaufwand, der bentigt wird, um eine " "Cloud zu fhren. Authentifizierungs- und Autorisierungs-Metadaten werden " "ordentlich in eine Nachricht gepackte Nutzlast gebndelt, die dann " "verschlsselt und als Farnet-Token angemeldet wird." msgid "For SQL, in ``/etc/keystone/keystone.conf`` , set:" msgstr "Fr SQL, in ``/etc/keystone/keystone.conf``, setzen Sie:" msgid "For ``memcached``, in ``/etc/keystone/keystone.conf``, set:" msgstr "Fr ``memcached``, in ``/etc/keystone/keystone.conf``, set:" msgid "" "For a distribution appropriate place, it should probably be copied to ``/usr/" "share/openstack/keystone/httpd/keystone.py``." msgstr "" "Fr einen Platz in einer Distribution sollte es wahrscheinlich auf ``/usr/" "share/openstack/keystone/httpd/keystone.py``kopiert werden." msgid "For example," msgstr "Beispielsweise," msgid "" "For example, the following URL would be considered protected by ``mod_shib`` " "and Apache, as such a request made to the URL would be redirected to the " "Identity Provider, to start the SAML authentication procedure." msgstr "" "Beispielsweise wrde die folgende URL als ``mod_shib`` und Apache " "betrachtet, da eine solche Anforderung an die URL an den Identity Provider " "weitergeleitet wird, um die SAML-Authentifizierungsprozedur zu starten." "For more information, see `Shibboleth Service Provider Configuration " "<https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/SHIB2/Configuration>`__." msgstr "" "Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter `Shibboleth Service Provider-" "Konfiguration <https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/SHIB2/" "Configuration>`__." msgid ""msgid "Future" msgstr "Zukunft" msgid "Generate metadata" msgstr "Metadaten erzeugen" msgid "Get a scoped token." msgstr "Holen Sie sich einen Scoped-Token." msgid "" "Ideally, to test that the Identity Provider and the Identity service are " "communicating, navigate to the protected URL and attempt to sign in. If you " "get a response back from keystone, even if it is a wrong response, indicates " "the communication." msgstr "" "Idealerweise, um zu testen, dass der Identity Provider und der Identity " "Service kommunizieren, navigieren Sie zu der geschtzten URL und versuchen " "Sie sich zu melden. Wenn Sie eine Antwort von Keystone erhalten, auch wenn " "es eine falsche Antwort ist, zeigt die Kommunikation an." "Identity service enforces ``external`` authentication when environment " "variable ``REMOTE_USER`` is present so make sure Shibboleth does not set the " "``REMOTE_USER`` environment variable. To do so, scan through the ``/etc/" "shibboleth/shibboleth2.xml`` configuration file and remove the " "``REMOTE_USER`` directives." msgstr "" "Identity Service erzwingt die ``externe``Authentifizierung, wenn die
" "Umgebungsvariable ``REMOTE_USER``vorhanden ist, also stellen Sie sicher,
" "dass Shibboleth die ``REMOTE_USER``Umgebungsvariable nicht setzt. Um dies
" "zu tun, scannen Sie durch die ``/etc/shibboleth/shibboleth2.xml``
" "Konfigurationsdatei und entfernen Sie die ``REMOTE_USER``Richtlinien." msgid """If new certificates are required, they can be easily created by executing:" msgstr "" "Wenn neue Zertifikate erforderlich sind, knnen sie einfach durch Ausfhren " "erstellt werden:" msgid """If you are running with SELinux enabled ensure that the file has the " "appropriate SELinux context to access the linked file. For example, if you " "have the file in ``/var/www/cgi-bin`` location, you can do this by running:" msgstr "" "Wenn Sie SELinux aktiviert haben, stellen Sie sicher, dass die Datei ber
" " den entsprechenden SELinux-Kontext verfgt, um auf die verknpfte Datei
" "zuzugreifen. Zum Beispiel, wenn Sie die Datei in ``/var/www/cgi-bin``
" " haben, knnen Sie dies tun, indem Sie:" msgid """If you have a firewall in place, configure it to allow TLS traffic. For " "example:" msgstr "" "Wenn Sie eine Firewall vorhanden haben, konfigurieren Sie sie, um TLS-" "Verkehr zuzulassen. Beispielsweise:" msgid """In OpenStack Newton release, there are four supported token types: UUID, " "PKI, PKIZ and fernet. Since OpenStack Ocata release, there are two supported " "token types: UUID and fernet." msgstr "" "Im OpenStack Newton Release gibt vier untersttzte Token-Typen: UUID, PKI, " "PKIZ und Fernet. Seit dem OpenStack Ocata Release gibt es zwei untersttzte " "Tokentypen: UUID und Fernet." msgid """In both cases, all servers that are storing tokens need a shared back end. " "This means either that both point to the same database server, or both point " "to a common memcached instance." msgstr "" "In beiden Fllen bentigen alle Server, die Token speichern, ein gemeinsames " "Backend. Dies bedeutet entweder, dass beide auf denselben Datenbankserver " "verweisen oder beide auf eine gemeinsame Memcached-Instanz verweisen." msgid """In order to create a trust between the Identity Provider and the Service " "Provider, metadata must be exchanged. To create metadata for your Identity " "service, run the :command:`keystone-manage` command and pipe the output to a " "file. For example:" msgstr "" "Um ein Vertrauen zwischen dem Identity Provider und dem Service Provider zu " "schaffen, mssen Metadaten ausgetauscht werden. Um Metadaten fr Ihren " "Identittsdienst zu erstellen, fhren Sie den Befehl :command:`keystone-" "manage` aus und fhren die Ausgabe in eine Datei. Beispielsweise:" msgid """In the returned unscoped token, a list of Identity service groups the user " "belongs to will be included." msgstr "" "In dem zurckgegebenen nicht kopierten Token wird eine Liste der " "Identittsdienstgruppen, zu denen der Benutzer gehrt, aufgenommen." msgid ""msgid "Install Shibboleth:" msgstr "Installiere Shibboleth:" "It is a burden on the clients to deal with multiple tokens across multiple " "cloud service providers. Federated Identity provides single sign on to the " "user, who can use the credentials provided and maintained by the user's IdP " "to access many different services on the Internet." msgstr "" "Es ist eine Belastung fr die Kunden, um mit mehreren Token ber mehrere " "Cloud-Dienstleister umzugehen. Fderierte Identitt bietet dem Benutzer ein " "einzelnes Anmeldeformular an, das die von der ID des Benutzers " "bereitgestellten und gepflegten Anmeldeinformationen nutzen kann, um auf " "viele verschiedene Dienste im Internet zuzugreifen." msgid "It is also recommended the following ``Contact`` options are set." msgstr "Es wird auch empfohlen, die folgenden ``Contact``Optionen zu setzen." msgid """It is assumed that the ``keystone`` service is running on port ``5000``." msgstr "" "Es wird davon ausgegangen, dass der ``Keystone``Service auf Port ``5000``
" " luft." msgid """It is recommended that the following ``Organization`` configuration options " "be setup." msgstr "" "Es wird empfohlen, die folgenden ``Organization``
" "Konfigurationsoptionen einzurichten." msgid """Lastly, if a scoped token and a Service Provider region are presented to " "keystone, the result will be a full SAML Assertion, signed by the IdP " "keystone, specifically intended for the Service Provider keystone." msgstr "" "Schlielich, wenn ein Scoped-Token und ein Service Provider Region Keystone " "prsentiert wird, wird das Ergebnis eine vollstndige SAML Assertion, die " "von der IdP Keystone, speziell fr die Service Provider Keystone, sein." msgid """List domains a federated user can access: ``GET /OS-FEDERATION/domains``" msgstr "" "List-Domains, die ein Verbundbenutzer aufrufen kann: ``GET /OS-FEDERATION/" "domains``" msgid "" "List projects a federated user can access: ``GET /OS-FEDERATION/projects``" msgstr "" "Listenprojekte, die ein Verbundbenutzer zugreifen kann: ``GET/OS-FEDERATION/" "projects``" msgid """Make sure you use either the SQL or the ``memcached`` driver for tokens, " "otherwise the tokens will not be shared between the processes of the Apache " "HTTPD server." msgstr "" "Vergewissern Sie sich, dass Sie entweder den SQL oder den ``memcached``
" "Treiber fr Token verwenden, sonst werden die Token nicht zwischen den
" "Prozessen des Apache HTTPD Servers geteilt." msgid ""msgid "Mapping" msgstr "Mapping" msgid "" "No new users will be added to the Identity back end, but the Identity " "service requires group-based role assignments to authorize federated users. " "The Federation mapping function will map the user into local Identity " "service groups objects, and hence to local role assignments." msgstr "" "Es werden keine neuen Benutzer zum Identity-Backend hinzugefgt, aber der " "Identity-Service erfordert gruppenbasierte Rollenzuweisungen, um fderierte " "Benutzer zu autorisieren. Die Fderationszuordnungsfunktion kartiert den " "Benutzer in lokale Identittsdienstgruppenobjekte und damit auf lokale " "Rollenzuweisungen." msgid "Note this needs to be added before your reject all rule which might be:" msgstr "" "Beachten Sie, dass dies hinzugefgt werden muss, bevor Sie alle Regeln " "ablehnen:" "Now that the Identity Provider and Identity service are communicating, you " "can start to configure the ``OS-FEDERATION`` extension." msgstr "" "Nun, da der Identity Provider und Identity Service kommunizieren, knnen " "Sie
" " beginnen, die ``OS-FEDERATION``Erweiterung zu konfigurieren." msgid """Once you have your Identity service virtual host ready, configure Shibboleth " "and upload your metadata to the Identity Provider." msgstr "" "Sobald Sie Ihren Identity Service virtuellen Host bereit haben, " "konfigurieren Sie Shibboleth und laden Sie Ihre Metadaten zum Identity " "Provider hoch." msgid ""msgid "PKI and PKIZ tokens" msgstr "PKI und PKIZ Token" msgid "" "PKI and PKIZ tokens are deprecated and not supported in Ocata. They are " "nearly identical and share the same payload. They are signed documents that " "contain the authentication content, as well as the service catalog. " "Depending on the size of the OpenStack deployment, PKI tokens can be very " "long. PKI and PKIZ tokens typically exceed 1600 bytes length. The length of " "a PKI or PKIZ token is dependent on the size of the deployment. Bigger " "service catalogs will result in longer token lengths. The Identity service " "uses public and private key pairs and certificates in order to create and " "validate these tokens. The difference between the two is PKIZ tokens are " "compressed to help mitigate the size issues of PKI." msgstr "" "PKI- und PKIZ-Token werden in Ocata abgelehnt und nicht untersttzt. Sie " "sind fast identisch und teilen sich die gleiche Nutzlast. Sie sind signierte " "Dokumente, die den Authentifizierungsinhalt enthalten, sowie den " "Servicekatalog. Abhngig von der Gre der OpenStack-Bereitstellung knnen " "PKI-Token sehr lang sein. PKI- und PKIZ-Token bersteigen typischerweise " "1600 Bytes Lnge. Die Lnge eines PKI- oder PKIZ-Tokens hngt von der Gre " "des Einsatzes ab. Grere Servicekataloge fhren zu lngeren Tokenlngen. " "Der Identittsdienst verwendet ffentliche und private Schlsselpaare und " "Zertifikate, um diese Token zu erstellen und zu validieren. Der Unterschied " "zwischen den beiden ist, dass PKIZ-Token komprimiert werden, um die " "Grenprobleme von PKI zu mildern." msgid "Performing Federation authentication" msgstr "Durchfhren der Fderationsauthentifizierung" msgid "Protocol" msgstr "Protokoll" msgid "" "Provisioning new identities often incurs some security risk. It is difficult " "to secure credential storage and to deploy it with proper policies. A common " "identity store is useful as it can be set up properly once and used in " "multiple places. With Federated Identity, there is no longer a need to " "provision user entries in Identity service, since the user entries already " "exist in the IdP's databases." msgstr "" "Die Bereitstellung neuer Identitten verursacht oft ein gewisses " "Sicherheitsrisiko. Es ist schwierig, die Berechtigungsspeicherung zu sichern " "und sie mit geeigneten Richtlinien zu implementieren. Ein gemeinsamer " "Identittsspeicher ist ntzlich, da er einmal richtig eingerichtet und an " "mehreren Stellen verwendet werden kann. Mit Federated Identity ist es nicht " "mehr ntig, Benutzereintrge im Identity Service bereitzustellen, da die " "Benutzereintrge bereits in den IDP-Datenbanken vorhanden sind." msgid "" "Removes a blocker to cloud brokering and multi-cloud workload management. " "There is no need to build additional authentication mechanisms to " "authenticate users, since the IdPs take care of authenticating their own " "users using whichever technologies they deem to be appropriate. In most " "organizations, multiple authentication technologies are already in use." msgstr "" "Entfernt einen Blocker zum Cloud-Brokering und Multi-Cloud-Workload-" "Management. Es besteht keine Notwendigkeit, zustzliche " "Authentifizierungsmechanismen zu bauen, um Benutzer zu authentifizieren, da " "die IdPs sich um die Authentifizierung ihrer eigenen Benutzer kmmern, " "welche Technologien sie fr angemessen halten. In den meisten Organisationen " "sind bereits mehrere Authentifizierungstechnologien im Einsatz." msgid "Restart Apache:" msgstr "Neustart Apache:" msgid "Restart the Shibboleth daemon:" msgstr "Starten Sie den Shibboleth-Daemon neu:" "Run the Identity service under Apache, instead of using ``keystone-all``." msgstr "" "Fhren Sie den Identittsdienst unter Apache aus, anstatt ``keystone-all``zu " "verwenden." msgid ""msgid "SAML assertion" msgstr "SAML Assertion" msgid "Scoped token" msgstr "Scoped Token" msgid "Setting Identity service as Identity Provider" msgstr "Einstellung Identity Service als Identity Provider" msgid "Testing it all out" msgstr "Testen Sie alles aus" "The Identity service administrator can create as many groups as there are " "SAML attributes, whatever the mapping calls for." msgstr "" "Der Identity Service Administrator kann so viele Gruppen wie SAML Attribute " "erstellen, was auch immer die Mapping fordert." msgid """The Identity service supports token revocation. This manifests as an API to " "revoke a token, to list revoked tokens and individual OpenStack services " "that cache tokens to query for the revoked tokens and remove them from their " "cache and append the same to their list of cached revoked tokens." msgstr "" "Der Identittsdienst untersttzt den Token-Widerruf. Dies manifestiert sich " "als API, um ein Token zu widerrufen, um widerrufene Token und einzelne " "OpenStack-Dienste aufzulisten, die Token fr die aufgehobenen Token " "abschneiden und sie aus ihrem Cache abholen und sie an ihre Liste der " "zwischengespeicherten widerrufenen Token anhngen." msgid """The ``ShibRequireSession`` rule is invalid in Apache 2.4 or newer and should " "be dropped in that specific setup." msgstr "" "Die ``ShibRequireSession``-Regel ist in Apache 2.4 oder neuer ungltig und
" "sollte in diesem speziellen Setup gelscht werden." msgid "" "The ``apt-get`` command is Ubuntu specific. For other distributions, replace " "with appropriate command." msgstr "" "Der ``apt-get``Befehl ist Ubuntu spezifisch. Fr andere Distributionen
" "ersetzen Sie durch entsprechenden Befehl." msgid """The ``external`` method should be dropped to avoid any interference with " "some Apache and Shibboleth SP setups, where a ``REMOTE_USER`` environment " "variable is always set, even as an empty value." msgstr "" "Die ``external``-Methode sollte gelscht werden, um jegliche Interferenzen
" "mit einigen Apache- und Shibboleth-SP-Setups zu vermeiden, wobei eine
" "Umgebungsvariable ``REMOTE_USER`` immer auch als leerer Wert gesetzt
" " ist." msgid """The ``service apache2 restart`` command is Ubuntu-specific. For other " "distributions, replace with appropriate command." msgstr "" "Der ``service apache2 restart``Befehl ist Ubuntu-spezifisch. Fr andere
" "Distributionen ersetzen Sie durch entsprechenden Befehl." msgid """The best test of interoperability in the cloud is the ability to enable a " "user with one set of credentials in an IdP to access multiple cloud " "services. Organizations, each using its own IdP can easily allow their users " "to collaborate and quickly share the same cloud services." msgstr "" "Der beste Test der Interoperabilitt in der Cloud ist die Fhigkeit, einen " "Benutzer mit einem Satz von Anmeldeinformationen in einem IdP zu aktivieren, " "um auf mehrere Cloud-Dienste zuzugreifen. Organisationen, die jeweils ihre " "eigenen IdP haben, knnen leicht ermglichen, mit ihren Benutzern zu " "kooperieren und schnell die gleichen Cloud-Services zu teilen." msgid """The file location should match the value of the configuration option " "``idp_metadata_path`` that was assigned in the list of ``[saml]`` updates." msgstr "" "Der Dateispeicherort sollte mit dem Wert der Konfigurationsoption ``
" "idp_metadata_path``bereinstimmen, die in der Liste der ``[saml] ``
" "Updates zugewiesen wurde." msgid """The following example shows a PKI token. Note that token ID values are " "typically 3500 bytes. In this example, the value has been truncated." msgstr "" "Das folgende Beispiel zeigt ein PKI-Token. Beachten Sie, dass Token-ID-Werte " "typischerweise 3500 Bytes sind. In diesem Beispiel wurde der Wert " "abgeschnitten." msgid """The newly created file will be stored under ``/etc/shibboleth/sp-key.pem``" msgstr "" "Die neu erstellte Datei wird unter ``/etc/shibboleth/sp-key.pem``gespeichert" msgid """The option ``saml2`` may be different in your deployment, but do not use a " "wildcard value. Otherwise every Federated protocol will be handled by " "Shibboleth." msgstr "" "Die Option ``saml2``kann in Ihrer Bereitstellung unterschiedlich sein,
" "aber keinen Wildcard-Wert verwenden. Andernfalls wird jedes Fderierte
" "Protokoll von Shibboleth behandelt." msgid ""msgid "" "This does introduce new challenges around protecting that identity. However, " "this is a worthwhile tradeoff given the greater control, and fewer " "credential databases that come with a centralized common identity store." msgstr "" "Dies stellt neue Herausforderungen fr den Schutz dieser Identitt dar. Dies " "ist jedoch ein lohnender Kompromiss bei der greren Kontrolle und weniger " "Credential-Datenbanken, die mit einem zentralisierten gemeinsamen " "Identittsspeicher kommen." msgid "" "This guide was last updated as of the Pike release, documenting the " "OpenStack Pike, Ocata, and Newton releases. It may not apply to EOL releases " "Mitaka, Kilo and Liberty." msgstr "" "Dieser Leitfaden wurde zuletzt von der Pike-Version aktualisiert und " "dokumentiert die OpenStack Pike, Ocata und Newton Releases. Es kann nicht " "gelten fr EOL Releases Mitaka, Kilo und Liberty." msgid "" "This instance follows a standard SAML2 authentication procedure, that is, " "the user will be redirected to the Identity Providers authentication " "webpage and be prompted for credentials. After successfully authenticating " "the user will be redirected to the Service Providers endpoint. If using a " "web browser, a token will be returned in XML format. As an alternative to " "using a web browser, you can use Enhanced Client or Proxy (ECP), which is " "available in the ``keystoneclient`` in the Identity service API." msgstr "" "Diese Instanz folgt einer Standard-SAML2-Authentifizierungsprozedur, d.h. " "der
" "Benutzer wird auf die Authentifizierungswebseite des Identity Providers
" "umgeleitet und zur Eingabe von Anmeldeinformationen aufgefordert. Nach
" "erfolgreicher Authentifizierung wird der Benutzer an den Endpunkt des
" "Dienstanbieters weitergeleitet. Bei Verwendung eines Webbrowsers wird ein
" "Token im XML-Format zurckgegeben. Alternativ zur Verwendung eines
" "Webbrowsers knnen Sie den Enhanced Client oder Proxy (ECP) verwenden, der
" "im ``keystoneclient``in der Identity Service API verfgbar ist." msgid "" "This path is Ubuntu-specific. For other distributions, replace with " "appropriate path." msgstr "" "Dieser Pfad ist Ubuntu-spezifisch. Fr andere Distributionen ersetzen Sie " "den entsprechenden Pfad." msgid "" "Thus, it is required to create the necessary Identity service groups that " "correspond to the Identity Providers groups; additionally, these groups " "should be assigned roles on one or more projects or domains. For example, " "groups here refers to the Identity service groups that should be created so " "that when mapping from the SAML attribute ``Employees``, you can map it to a " "Identity service group ``devs``." msgstr "" "So ist es erforderlich, die notwendigen Identittsdienstgruppen zu " "erstellen, die den Gruppen des Identittsanbieters entsprechen. Darber " "hinaus sollten diese Gruppen Rollen auf einem oder mehreren Projekten oder " "Domains zugeordnet werden. Zum Beispiel bezieht sich die Gruppe hier auf die " "Identittsdienstgruppen, die so angelegt werden sollen, dass sie bei der " "Zuordnung aus dem SAML-Attribut ``Employees``eine Identity Service Group " "``devs``abbilden knnen." msgid "To enable Federation, perform the following steps:" msgstr "Um Federation zu aktivieren, fhren Sie die folgenden Schritte aus:" "To start Federated authentication a user must access the dedicated URL with " "Identity Providers and Protocols identifiers stored within a protected " "URL. The URL has a format of: ``/v3/OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/" "{identity_provider}/protocols/{protocol}/auth``." msgstr "" "Um die fderierte Authentifizierung zu starten, muss ein Benutzer auf die " "dedizierte URL zugreifen, wobei Identifikationsanbieter und Protokolle in " "einer geschtzten URL gespeichert sind. Die URL hat ein Format von: ``/v3 /" "OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/{identity_provider}/protocols/{protocol}/" "auth``." msgid """To utilize Federation, create the following in the Identity service: " "Identity Provider, Mapping, Protocol." msgstr "" "Um Fderation zu nutzen, erschaffen Sie Folgendes im Identity Service: " "Identity Provider, Mapping, Protocol." msgid ""msgid "" "Too much time is spent administering identities in various service providers." msgstr "" "Zu viel Zeit wird vergeutet in die Vergabe von Identitten bei " "verschiedenen Dienstleistern." msgid "UUID tokens" msgstr "UUID-Token" msgid "" "UUID tokens are persistent tokens. UUID tokens are 32 bytes in length and " "must be persisted in the back-end. They are stored in the Identity service " "back-end along with the metadata for authentication. Clients must pass their " "UUID token to the Identity service in order to validate it. According to the " "release notes for Pike(see `release notes <https://docs.openstack.org/" "releasenotes/keystone/pike.html#deprecation-notes>`_), UUID token provider " "is being deprecated in favor of Fernet tokens." msgstr "" "UUID-Token sind pesistente Token. UUID-Token sind 32 Bytes lang und mssen " "im Back-End persistiert sein. Sie werden im Identity Service Back-End " "zusammen mit den Metadaten fr die Authentifizierung gespeichert. Kunden " "mssen ihr UUID-Token an den Identity-Dienst bergeben, um es zu validieren. " "Laut den Versionshinweisen fr Pike(siehe `Versionshinweise <https://docs." "openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/pike.html#deprecation-notes>`_), wird " "der UUID-Token-Provider zugunsten von Fernet-Token veraltet." "Unlike UUID, PKI and PKIZ tokens, fernet tokens do not require persistence. " "The keystone token database no longer suffers bloat as a side effect of " "authentication. Pruning expired tokens from the token database is no longer " "required when using fernet tokens. Since fernet tokens are non-persistent, " "they do not have to be replicated. As long as each keystone node shares the " "same repository, fernet tokens can be created and validated instantly across " "nodes." msgstr "" "Im Gegensatz zu UUID-, PKI- und PKIZ-Token bentigen Fernet-Token keine " "Persistenz. Die Keystone-Token-Datenbank erleidet nicht mehr als Nebeneffekt " "der Authentifizierung. Das Beschneiden abgelaufener Token aus der Token-" "Datenbank ist bei der Verwendung von Fernet-Token nicht mehr erforderlich. " "Da Fernet-Token nicht persistent sind, mssen sie nicht repliziert werden. " "Solange jeder Keystone-Knoten das gleiche Repository teilt, knnen Fernet-" "Token sofort ber Knoten erstellt und validiert werden." msgid ""msgid "Unscoped token" msgstr "Unscoped Token" msgid "Upload your Service Providers metadata file to your Identity Provider." msgstr "" "Laden Sie die Metadaten-Datei Ihres Dienstanbieters an Ihren Identity " "Provider." msgid "" "Users spend too much time logging in or going through 'Forget Password' " "workflows. Federated identity allows for single sign on, which is easier and " "faster for users and requires fewer password resets. The IdPs manage user " "identities and passwords so OpenStack does not have to." msgstr "" "Benutzer verbringen zu viel Zeit, sich einzuloggen oder durch den Ablauf " "'Passwort vergessen' zu gehen. Fderierte Identitt ermglicht Single Sign " "On, die fr Benutzer einfacher und schneller ist und weniger Passwort " "zurcksetzt. Die IdPs verwalten Benutzeridentitten und Passwrter, so dass " "OpenStack das nicht nicht tun muss." msgid "" "Within the ``keystone.conf`` assign values to the ``[saml]`` related fields, " "for example:" msgstr "" "Innerhalb der ``keystone.conf``weisen Sie den ``[saml] ``verwandten
" "Feldern Werte zu, z.B.:"

subject: Fixes compatibility with python34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 00:00:13.000000000', 'files': ['virtualbmc/vbmc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/virtualbmc/commit/6947e30df463e0d61655cf4434bc4121e0915972', 'message': "Fixes compatibility with python34

The xml package changed ElementTree with python 3.x to return a
bytestring when calling 'tostring' method as the default behavior.
Libvirt complains when trying to create the domain that it is expecting
a string.  This patch fixes the issue by specifying the encoding type as
unicode.  This should work for python 2.x and python 3.x.

Change-Id: I7f517b5f44f57a644ed5bc44097e3230311f980b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes compatibility with python34

The xml package changed ElementTree with python 3.x to return a
bytestring when calling 'tostring' method as the default behavior.
Libvirt complains when trying to create the domain that it is expecting
a string.  This patch fixes the issue by specifying the encoding type as
unicode.  This should work for python 2.x and python 3.x.

Change-Id: I7f517b5f44f57a644ed5bc44097e3230311f980b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/virtualbmc refs/changes/17/492717/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: conn.defineXML(ET.tostring(tree, encoding='unicode'))

commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I98d52f3b259cfffeb0e8ec996279ad4ff782276d

commit_message:
Add periodic logs during database mechanism

This patch will help operator and developer who can
follow actions during checking server status and
service status of creating/deleting mechanism.

Change-Id: I479628d66a9016750a21d9846358406e097525e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/03/675803/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use SDK for setting instance id

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for the _set_instance_id function.

Blueprint: openstacksdk-in-nova
Change-Id: I95f3414d29a5ff5cc49994bac1cda917edc4f292
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/659690/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test__set_instance_id(self): self.driver._set_instance_id(node, instance) self.mock_conn.update_node.has_calls( [mock.call(node, retry_on_conflict=False, instance_id=instance.id)])
deleted_lines: @mock.patch.object(cw.IronicClientWrapper, 'call') def test__set_instance_uuid(self, mock_call): expected_patch = [{'path': '/instance_uuid', 'op': 'add', 'value': instance.uuid}] self.driver._set_instance_uuid(node, instance) mock_call.has_calls( [mock.call('node.update', node.uuid, expected_patch, retry_on_conflict=False)])

subject: Skipping sg rule deletion for pods without annotations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-30 16:23:35.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/controller/handlers/vif.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/ac7a5935f6112ad1274571e00186e90f2bb7b27b', 'message': 'Skipping sg rule deletion for pods without annotations

This patch set skips the error when NPs are enabled and a pod that
has not yet been annotated by kuryr is deleted (for instance a pod
in pending status). The information about the IP is found on the
annotations and as that is not already there no rules would have
been created. Thus no need to remove them.

Change-Id: I850dc2d66fac2d7b44267382062093b19e5cd442
Closes-Bug: 1842099
'}]
commit_message:
Skipping sg rule deletion for pods without annotations

This patch set skips the error when NPs are enabled and a pod that
has not yet been annotated by kuryr is deleted (for instance a pod
in pending status). The information about the IP is found on the
annotations and as that is not already there no rules would have
been created. Thus no need to remove them.

Change-Id: I850dc2d66fac2d7b44267382062093b19e5cd442
Closes-Bug: 1842099
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/77/679477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (driver_utils.is_host_network(pod) or not pod['spec'].get('nodeName')): try: crd_pod_selectors = self._drv_sg.delete_sg_rules(pod) except k_exc.ResourceNotReady: # NOTE(ltomasbo): If the pod is being deleted before # kuryr-controller annotated any information about the port # associated, there is no need for deleting sg rules associated to # it. So this exception could be safetly ignored for the current # sg drivers. Only the NP driver associates rules to the pods ips, # and that waits for annotations to start. LOG.debug("Pod was not yet annotated by Kuryr-controller. " "Skipping SG rules deletion associated to the pod %s", pod) crd_pod_selectors = [] if (self._is_network_policy_enabled() and crd_pod_selectors and

commit_message:
Extract SEV-specific bits on host detection

Extract reducedPhysBits and cbitpos when detecting that host is
SEV-enabled.

These parameters will later be used to configure the guest.
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#sev-launch-time-configuration

Change-Id: I1d9308147a389fc94b7e872f9bd0621bdb25b193
blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/636334/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.cbitpos = None self.reduced_phys_bits = None for c in xmldoc.getchildren(): if c.tag == 'reducedPhysBits': self.reduced_phys_bits = int(c.text) elif c.tag == 'cbitpos': self.cbitpos = int(c.text)

subject: Added information how to use JsonFilter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-28 06:57:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/00d69ba3737fa3dbc051fb9c46a2b51fa8ce2739', 'message': 'Added information how to use JsonFilter

Creating a query hint to use JsonFilter that will choose
required backed to create a volume was complicated.
Added description how to use that will be helpful for others.

Change-Id: If04f037cf55b5b9d116927aa4b23a9c42d7b53e6

commit_message:
Added information how to use JsonFilter

Creating a query hint to use JsonFilter that will choose
required backed to create a volume was complicated.
Added description how to use that will be helpful for others.

Change-Id: If04f037cf55b5b9d116927aa4b23a9c42d7b53e6
Co-authored-by: Bartosz Rabiega <bartosz.rabiega@corp.ovh.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/04/679004/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Backend filter for simple JSON-based grammar for selecting backends. If you want to choose one of your backend, make a query hint, for example: cinder create --hint query='["=", "$backend_id", "rbd:vol@ceph#cloud"]' """
deleted_lines: """Backend filter for simple JSON-based grammar for selecting backends."""

commit_message:
Use SDK for validating instance and node

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for the instance_exists function.

Blueprint: openstacksdk-in-nova
Change-Id: I764b0086d0bf39d4ca8cb308696169282b12b42b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/656028/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_instance_exists(self): mock_get_node = mock.Mock(return_value=instance) self.driver.ironicconn.get_node = mock_get_node self.assertTrue(self.driver.instance_exists(instance)) mock_get_node.assert_called_once_with(self.instance_uuid) def test_instance_exists_fail(self): mock_get_node = mock.Mock(side_effect=ironic_exception.NotFound) self.driver.ironicconn.get_node = mock_get_node mock_get_node.assert_called_once_with(self.instance_uuid)
deleted_lines: @mock.patch.object(cw.IronicClientWrapper, 'call') def test_instance_exists(self, mock_call): self.assertTrue(self.driver.instance_exists(instance)) mock_call.assert_called_once_with('node.get_by_instance_uuid', self.instance_uuid, fields=ironic_driver._NODE_FIELDS) @mock.patch.object(cw.IronicClientWrapper, 'call') def test_instance_exists_fail(self, mock_call): mock_call.side_effect = ironic_exception.NotFound mock_call.assert_called_once_with('node.get_by_instance_uuid', self.instance_uuid, fields=ironic_driver._NODE_FIELDS)

subject: Add <launchSecurity> and <driver iommu='on' /> to config.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-12 12:10:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/89419f1a3983c6edeea217c9720e903b782e2e63', 'message': 'Add configs for AMD SEV

AMD SEV requires to set several attributes to enable it:

 - launchSecurity
 - memtune with hard_limit

In addition to that, it requires to enable iommu driver for all virtio
devices, even if guest or host have no iommu device.

Add a class to create required elements and modify existing ones for SEV.

Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442

 - launchSecurity
 - memtune with hard_limit

In addition to that, it requires to enable iommu driver for all virtio

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2019-05-17 18:31:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/43554b221dbe19b6e5647de0491131b62317ef26', 'message': 'Add <launchSecurity> element to libvirt guest XML for AMD SEV

AMD SEV requires the <launchSecurity> element in the libvirt guest XML
to enable it.  So add a LibvirtConfigGuestSEVLaunchSecurity class to
create the required element, and modify LibvirtConfigGuest to use it.

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2019-05-24 23:49:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/290eca80ab8a337c7ed555363899474ff6c5c216', 'message': 'Add <launchSecurity> element to libvirt guest XML for AMD SEV

AMD SEV requires the <launchSecurity> element in the libvirt guest XML
to enable it.  So add a LibvirtConfigGuestSEVLaunchSecurity class to
create the required element, and modify LibvirtConfigGuest to use it.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2019-05-31 19:37:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4ef57ceaa21bd7aa7f801af63d00a43e390b9ec1', 'message': 'Add configs for AMD SEV

AMD SEV requires to set several attributes to enable it:

 - launchSecurity
 - memoryBacking with <locked /> element

In addition to that, it requires to enable iommu driver for all virtio
devices, even if guest or host have no iommu device.

Add required bits for the launchSecurity element

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2019-06-01 10:29:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d70f677e785422126e7f2e1167116438b779da20', 'message': 'Add configs for AMD SEV

'}, {'number': 17, 'created': '2019-06-20 20:39:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e55e52719d3e11efa0553567cee198ff1cf57563', 'message': "Add <launchSecurity> and <driver iommu='on' /> to AMD SEV guest configs

<launchSecurity> enables use of SEV, so add the required config class
for it.  For now the class just describes the new element, it will be
used in further commits.

Furthermore, AMD SEV requires enabling DMA APIs for virtio devices
via <driver iommu='on' />:

  http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#proposed-change

So add the necessary bits for that to domain configuration.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442

commit_message:
Add <launchSecurity> and <driver iommu='on' /> to config.py

<launchSecurity> enables use of SEV, so add the required config class
for it.  For now the class just describes the new element; it will be
used in further commits.

Furthermore, AMD SEV requires enabling DMA APIs for virtio devices
via <driver iommu='on' />:

  http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#proposed-change

So also add the necessary bits for that to domain configuration.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/18/636318/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_sev_features(self): # test that sev-specific bits are added to the xml obj = config.LibvirtConfigGuestSEV() obj.memtune_limit = 100 obj.cbitpos = 47 obj.reduced_phys_bits = 1 features = obj.get_features() launch_security_expected = """ <launchSecurity type="sev"> <policy>0x0037</policy> <cbitpos>47</cbitpos> <reducedPhysBits>1</reducedPhysBits> </launchSecurity>""" memtune_expected = """ <memtune> <hard_limit unit="KiB">100</hard_limit> </memtune>""" self.assertXmlEqual(features[0].to_xml(), launch_security_expected) self.assertXmlEqual(features[1].to_xml(), memtune_expected) def test_sev_modifiers(self): original_xml = """ <domain type="kvm" id="47"> <name>TestVm</name> <uuid>b044f644-5cbd-42b0-b9b9-298c8d885160</uuid> <memory unit='KiB'>4194304</memory> <currentMemory unit='KiB'>4194304</currentMemory> <devices> <disk type="file" device="disk"> <source file="/tmp/img"/> <target bus="virtio" dev="/dev/vda"/> </disk> <controller type='virtio-serial' index='0'> <alias name='virtio-serial0'/> <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x02' slot='0x00' function='0x0'/> </controller> <controller type='scsi' index='0' model='virtio-scsi'> <alias name='scsi0'/> <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x08' slot='0x00' function='0x0'/> </controller> <redirdev bus='usb' type='spicevmc'> <alias name='redir1'/> <address type='usb' bus='0' port='3'/> </redirdev> <memballoon model='virtio'> <alias name='balloon0'/> <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x06' slot='0x00' function='0x0'/> </memballoon> </devices> </domain>""" # expected xml is different by having <driver iommu='on' /> elements expected_xml = """ <domain type="kvm" id="47"> <name>TestVm</name> <uuid>b044f644-5cbd-42b0-b9b9-298c8d885160</uuid> <memory unit='KiB'>4194304</memory> <currentMemory unit='KiB'>4194304</currentMemory> <devices> <disk type="file" device="disk"> <source file="/tmp/img"/> <target bus="virtio" dev="/dev/vda"/> </disk> <controller type='virtio-serial' index='0'> <alias name='virtio-serial0'/> <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x02' slot='0x00' function='0x0'/> <driver iommu='on' /> </controller> <controller type='scsi' index='0' model='virtio-scsi'> <alias name='scsi0'/> <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x08' slot='0x00' function='0x0'/> <driver iommu='on' /> </controller> <redirdev bus='usb' type='spicevmc'> <alias name='redir1'/> <address type='usb' bus='0' port='3'/> </redirdev> <memballoon model='virtio'> <alias name='balloon0'/> <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x06' slot='0x00' function='0x0'/> <driver iommu='on' /> </memballoon> </devices> </domain>""" tree = etree.fromstring(original_xml) obj = config.LibvirtConfigGuestSEV() obj.memtune_limit = 100 obj.cbitpos = 47 obj.reduced_phys_bits = 1 modifiers = obj.get_modifiers() for modifier in modifiers: modifier(tree) self.assertXmlEqual(expected_xml, etree.tostring(tree))

commit_message:
Pass Domain Name to dhcp options

On subnet create dns_options are passed to OVN.
This patch adds missing domain_name field, which
is needed to support InternalDNS functionality.

Change-Id: I01e95ceb10bd6b4e0d9562c9a2abbefa85cdf1d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/23/660423/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: net_dns_domain = net.get('dns_domain', '').rstrip('.') if net_dns_domain: # NOTE(mjozefcz): String field should be with quotes, # otherwise ovn will try to resolve it as variable. options['domain_name'] = '"%s"' % net_dns_domain

subject: Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-10 18:36:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a662fd015ea6e48d316a9fa5cf5e282b4a81735f', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new hw:mem_encryption extra spec parameter, and a new
hw_mem_encryption image property, which indicate that any guest booted
with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively needs to
be booted with its memory hardware encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the parameter and property into a
resource request for one slot of the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory
provided by Ib1304e65f1.

Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-06-11 15:45:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/28513132d9afcb053247b7a15e04d32be57f8862', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the parameter and property into a
resource request for one slot of the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory
provided by Ib1304e65f1.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a RequestFilterFailed exception.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2019-06-17 15:13:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/53934c35df3c7f203d30081548bf46abbc8b5c6e', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the
MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory provided by Ib1304e65f1.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requesters() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2019-06-17 15:53:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/78ce79791635878830fac31ca1093946a9c135c4', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the
MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory provided by Ib1304e65f1.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requesters() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requesters(), and then caught and re-raised as a
RequestFilterFailed exception.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7

"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in

follow-up commit Ib1304e65f1.

also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requested(), and then if caught during the request
filter phase is re-raised as a RequestFilterFailed exception, or if
caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requested(), and then if caught during the request
filter phase is re-raised as a RequestFilterFailed exception, or if
caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7

'}, {'number': 34, 'created': '2019-08-19 13:09:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/494bdbfca06f4e9f5651cedf8bd10fdce99ad8b4', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during the request filter phase is re-raised as a
RequestFilterFailed exception, or if caught during API call
validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7

'}, {'number': 38, 'created': '2019-08-20 13:17:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d129e0d962203e2225ed8c907a8f7734bf833230', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during the request filter phase is re-raised as a
RequestFilterFailed exception, or if caught during API call
validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7

commit_message:
Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as
HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

commit_message:
neutron-tempest-plugin: Switch to python3

- Also drop the doc package. There is no useful doc to build.

Change-Id: I8fde07b95c84bd48ca858c5993f9e5a2161c716a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/60/679960/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Name: {{ py2name() }}BuildRequires: {{ py3('pbr') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('tempest') }} Requires: {{ py3('ddt') }} Requires: {{ py3('debtcollector') }} Requires: {{ py3('eventlet') }} Requires: {{ py3('netaddr') }} Requires: {{ py3('neutron-lib') }} Requires: {{ py3('oslo.config') }} Requires: {{ py3('oslo.log') }} Requires: {{ py3('oslo.serialization') }} Requires: {{ py3('oslo.utils') }} Requires: {{ py3('paramiko') }} Requires: {{ py3('pbr') }} Requires: {{ py3('six') }} Requires: {{ py3('testscenarios') }} Requires: {{ py3('testtools') }}This package contains Tempest tests to cover the neutron project. Additionally it provides a plugin to automatically load these tests into Tempest.%autosetup -p1 -n {{ pypi_name }}-{{ upstream_version }}%{py3_build}%{py3_install}%{python3_sitelib}/neutron_tempest_plugin %{python3_sitelib}/*.egg-info

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-07-03 10:31:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cyborg/commit/0f417e64d4cfce5c976c5e5178d8134681ede639', 'message': 'Placement report

1. Create resource provider, resource class, traits.
2. Nested resource provider is supported in this patch.
3. According to the comments and reply in:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/626057/10/cyborg/common/placement_client.py,
we should make a class to invoke Placement API. This has also been done in
this patch.
4. More info for driver developer, each driver should report resource class
and traits in driver_attribute field in order that cyborg-conductor can parse
it and report to placement.

Change-Id: Ib8f682255d2ae60eb615c90de0a0f7c83d1af54d

commit_message:
Placement report

1. Create resource provider, resource class, traits.
2. Nested resource provider is supported in this patch.
3. According to the comments and reply in:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/626057/10/cyborg/common/placement_client.py,
we should make a class to invoke Placement API. This has also been done in
this patch.
4. Convert cyborg/objects/driver_objects/driver_device.py file type from dos to
unix, to avoid ^M at the end of each line.
5. Get rid of legacy: ProviderTree class.
6. More info for driver developers:  each driver should report resource class
and traits in driver_attribute field in order that cyborg-conductor can parse
it and report to placement.
7. update deployable rp_uuid field after getting rp_uuid from placement.

Change-Id: Ib8f682255d2ae60eb615c90de0a0f7c83d1af54d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/33/659233/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add disk format content from Image Guide

The container_format and disk_format identifiers and their
descriptions are being maintained in the Glance docs.  Move some
useful content on this topic over from the Image Guide before
deleting it over there so it's only being maintained in one
location.

Change-Id: Ifa8de9d3a3a2aa78ee305aaebb23cd982b02dd91
Partial-bug: #1842343
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/92/679692/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This is an unstructured disk image format. The ``raw`` image format is the simplest one, and is natively supported by both KVM and Xen hypervisors. You can think of a raw image as being the bit-equivalent of a block device file, created as if somebody had copied, say, ``/dev/sda`` to a file using the :command:`dd` command. This is the VHD (Virtual Hard Disk) disk format, a common disk format used by virtual machine monitors from VMware, Xen, Microsoft, VirtualBox, and others. This is the `VHDX <http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh831446.aspx>`_ format, an enhanced version of the ``vhd`` format. It has support for larger disk sizes and protection against data corruption during power failures. The `VMDK <https://developercenter.vmware.com/web/sdk/60/vddk>`_ (Virtual Machine Disk) format is supported by many common virtual machine monitors, for example the VMware ESXi hypervisor. The `VDI <https://forums.virtualbox.org/viewtopic.php?t=8046>`_ (Virtual Disk Image) format for image files is supported by the VirtualBox virtual machine monitor and the QEMU emulator. The `ISO <http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-119.htm>`_ format is a disk image formatted with the read-only ISO 9660 (also known as ECMA-119) filesystem commonly used for CDs and DVDs. A disk format supported and used by Virtuozzo to run OS Containers. The `QCOW2 <http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/QEMU/Images>`_ (QEMU copy-on-write version 2) format is commonly used with the KVM hypervisor. It uses a sparse representation, so the image size is smaller than a raw format file of the same virtual disk. It can expand dynamically and supports Copy on Write. The `AKI/AMI/ARI <http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/AMIs.html>`_ format was the initial image format supported by Amazon EC2. The image consists of three files, each of which has its own specific ``disk_format`` identifier: This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon Kernel Image (AKI). It is a kernel file that the hypervisor will load initially to boot the image. For a Linux machine, this would be a ``vmlinuz`` file. This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon Ramdisk Image (ARI). It is an optional ramdisk file mounted at boot time. For a Linux machine, this would be an ``initrd`` file. This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon Machine Image (AMI). It is a virtual machine image in raw format. This indicates there is no container or metadata envelope for the image. `OVF <http://dmtf.org/sites/default/files/OVF_Overview_Document_2010.pdf>`_ (Open Virtualization Format) is a packaging format for virtual machines, defined by the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) standards group. An OVF package contains one or more image files, a ``.ovf`` XML metadata file that contains information about the virtual machine, and possibly other files as well. An OVF package can be distributed in different ways. For example, it could be distributed as a set of discrete files, or as a tar archive file with an ``.ova`` (open virtual appliance/application) extension. This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon kernel image. This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon ramdisk image. This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon machine image. This indicates what is stored in Glance is an OVA tar archive file, that is, an OVF package contained in a single tar archive file. the container filesystem.
deleted_lines: This is an unstructured disk image format This is the VHD disk format, a common disk format used by virtual machine monitors from VMware, Xen, Microsoft, VirtualBox, and others This is the VHDX disk format, an enhanced version of the vhd format which supports larger disk sizes among other features. Another common disk format supported by many common virtual machine monitors A disk format supported by VirtualBox virtual machine monitor and the QEMU emulator An archive format for the data contents of an optical disc (e.g. CDROM). A disk format supported and used by Virtuozzo to run OS Containers A disk format supported by the QEMU emulator that can expand dynamically and supports Copy on Write This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon kernel image This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon ramdisk image This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon machine image This indicates there is no container or metadata envelope for the image This is the OVF container format This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon kernel image This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon ramdisk image This indicates what is stored in Glance is an Amazon machine image This indicates what is stored in Glance is an OVA tar archive file the container filesystem
